title: Ticket #6672: Treat blank mapfile lines as warnings instead of errors
description:
With the CHTC version of HTCondor-CE, we are shipping the following default condor_mapfile with a few blank lines:

https://github.com/opensciencegrid/htcondor-ce/blob/master/config/condor_mapfile

This results in the following errors in each daemon's logs: 

05/08/18 11:57:44 ERROR: Error parsing line 7 of /etc/condor-ce/condor_mapfile.  (Method=) (Principal=) (Canon=) Skipping to next line.
05/08/18 11:57:44 ERROR: Error parsing line 13 of /etc/condor-ce/condor_mapfile.  (Method=) (Principal=) (Canon=) Skipping to next line.
05/08/18 11:57:44 ERROR: Error parsing line 20 of /etc/condor-ce/condor_mapfile.  (Method=) (Principal=) (Canon=) Skipping to next line.
05/08/18 11:57:44 ERROR: Error parsing line 24 of /etc/condor-ce/condor_mapfile.  (Method=) (Principal=) (Canon=) Skipping to next line.
05/08/18 11:57:44 ERROR: Error parsing line 30 of /etc/condor-ce/condor_mapfile.  (Method=) (Principal=) (Canon=) Skipping to next line.

Can we downgrade these to just warnings and maybe throw them in D_FULLDEBUG instead of the default log level? They don't seem to have a negative effect on the actual mappings.
remarks:
2018-Jun-15 10:25:52 by jfrey:
I plan to have the code silently ignore blank lines. I don't see a reason for it to care at all.

2018-Jun-15 10:42:33 by jfrey:
You are correct. The blank lines have no effect other than the scary messages in the daemon log.

2018-Jun-15 10:59:57 by zmiller:
CODE REVIEW: Looks good.
check_ins: 2018-Jun-15 10:54   Check-in [55067]: Ignore blank lines in the security and user map files. #6672 No change in behavior, other than removing a scary looking ERROR line in the dameon log. (By Jaime Frey )
